title: Immune Cell Isolation from Mouse Spleen
original description: To isolate immune cells from a mouse spleen before sorting
steps:
1. Prepare 50mL of 10% FBS RPMI media 
5amount 
45amount 
NOTES **other media may be used
2. Wet both sides of a 70μm filter with media above a 50mL conical (make sure there is some media in the conical)
3. Place spleen on filter, use the plunger base of a syringe to mash the spleen on to the filter while pouring media through
4. Continue pouring media through filter while mashing until spleen is completely mashed. About 30 to 35mL of media should be used   
35amount
5. Keep suspended cells on ice in the 10% FBS RPMI media until preparing for sort
6. Spin cells down at 350g for 3 min (pulse to 550g if necessary)
7. Remove supernatant
8. Resuspend pellet in 1mL of ACK lysing buffer for 1 min on ice  
60s
9. Add 30mL of media, spin down at 350g for 3 min (pulse to 550g if necessary) 
NOTES **if pellet is still red, another round of ACK might be needed 
30amount
10. Stain with desired antibodies, filter with sorting filters, dilute if large pellet
ai_generated_description: The objective of this molecular biology protocol is to isolate immune cells from a mouse spleen before conducting further analysis or cell sorting. The isolated cells can then be stained with desired antibodies, filtered, and diluted as required for subsequent experiments.

edited_pseudocode:
def prepare_media(base_media, fbs_percentage, volume): pass
def wet_filter(filter_pore_size, media_volume, conical_volume): pass
def mash_spleen_on_filter(spleen, filter_pore_size, media_volume, plunger): pass
def keep_cells_on_ice(media_type, cell_suspension): pass
def spin_cells(cell_suspension, centrifuge_settings): pass
def remove_supernatant(cell_suspension): pass
def resuspend_pellet(cell_pellet, buffer_type, volume, incubation_time, temperature): pass
def add_media(cell_pellet, volume): pass
def repeat_ACK_steps(cell_pellet, buffer_type, volume, incubation_time, temperature): pass
def stain_cells(cell_suspension, antibody_list, sorting_filters, dilution_factor=None): pass

# Protocol steps
prepare_media(base_media="RPMI", fbs_percentage=10, volume=50)
wet_filter(filter_pore_size=70, media_volume="enough to wet filter", conical_volume="some media in the conical")
mashed_spleen = mash_spleen_on_filter(spleen="mouse spleen", filter_pore_size=70, media_volume="30-35 mL", plunger="syringe plunger base")
cell_suspension = keep_cells_on_ice(media_type="10% FBS RPMI", cell_suspension=mashed_spleen)
pellet = spin_cells(cell_suspension=cell_suspension, centrifuge_settings="350g, 3 min (pulse to 550g if necessary)")
clean_pellet = remove_supernatant(cell_suspension=pellet)
resuspended_pellet = resuspend_pellet(cell_pellet=clean_pellet, buffer_type="ACK", volume="1 mL", incubation_time="1 min", temperature="ice")
cell_suspension_after_ACK = add_media(cell_pellet=resuspended_pellet, volume="30 mL")
pellet_after_ACK = spin_cells(cell_suspension=cell_suspension_after_ACK, centrifuge_settings="350g, 3 min (pulse to 550g if necessary)")

# Check if another round of ACK is needed
if pellet_after_ACK == "still red":
    repeat_ACK_steps(cell_pellet=pellet_after_ACK, buffer_type="ACK", volume="1 mL", incubation_time="1 min", temperature="ice")

stained_cells = stain_cells(cell_suspension=pellet_after_ACK, antibody_list="desired antibodies", sorting_filters="sorting filters", dilution_factor="if large pellet")
# end of protocol
